primaryColor.description: Primary color to be used in Konfig's API Portal

customSnippet.description: Path to file containing HTML to be added in the <head> of the docs. This is useful if you want to include a custom snippets in the docs.

googleAnalyticsId.description: Google Analytics ID. If provided, Konfig's API Portal will include Google Analytics tracking.

favicon.description: Relative path to favicon image used for Konfig's API Portal

anyOf.description: Light and dark logos for Konfig's API Portal

logo.description: Relative path to logo image used for Konfig's API Portal. If an object is provided, the light logo will be used for light mode and the dark logo will be used for dark mode.

hideNonSdkSnippets.description: Do not show non-SDK snippets in the API Reference page of the API Portal. This is useful if your API is not easily usable without an SDK or if you do not want developers to use your API without an SDK.

title.description: Title to be used in Konfig's API Portal

sidebar.description: Configuration of sidebar to navigate the documentation. Supports sections, links, and grouped links.

documentation.description: Markdown-based Documentation to be uploaded to Konfig's API Portal

hideOperations.description: List of operations to hide in Konfig's API Portal. The first key is the path and the second is the HTTP method.

betaOperations.description: Mark operations as beta in the API documentation and SDKs. The first key is the path and the second is the HTTP method.

cta.description: Adds a call-to-action button at the top-right of the docs.

hideSecurity.description: List of security names to hide in Konfig's API Portal

portal.description: Configuration for API portal generated by Konfig

tag.description: This represents the tag name from the OpenAPI specification.

anyOf.description: This represents the operationId from the OpenAPI specification.

method.description: This represents the operation's HTTP method.

anyOf.description: This represents the operation's subpath and HTTP method.

operations.description: An ordered list of operations associated with the tag. Each operation can be an operationId or a combination of subpath and HTTP method.

items.description: A schema that represents a tag and its associated operations in a user-defined order.

order.description: An ordered list of tags, where each tag has its associated operations. This represents the user-defined order for displaying tags and operations in the API documentation.

image.description: Relative path from konfig.yaml to image

title.description: Title to be displayed in SDKs README.md

url.description: URL to redirect to when clicking on the image

readmeHeader.description: Call to action to be displayed in SDKs README.md

useSecurityKeyName.description:
Instead of using the security scheme's key, use the security scheme's name in the OpenAPI specification.

For example take the following OAS security scheme:

components:
  securitySchemes:
    apiKey: # <- security name
      type: apiKey
      in: header
      name: X-API-Key # <- security key

If this field is true then "X-API-Key" will be used instead of "apiKey" in the generated SDKs.

readmeOperation.description: Operation to be displayed in "Getting Started" section of SDKs README.md

portalTitle.description: Title to be used in Konfig's API Portal

defaultChangesetBumpType.description: Default changeset bump type for 'konfig changeset' command

inheritMetadataSpecPath.description: Path to OAS to inherit metadata such as examples, descriptions, summaries, and tags. This is useful if you have multiple OpenAPI Specifications. One that includes extra metadata (usually hand-written) and one that is used to generate SDKs (usually generated from code).

modify.description: A JSON where the key is a JSON Path pointing to a location in the OAS and the value is the JSON value to be placed at the location.

update.description: A JSON where the key is a JSON Path pointing to a location in the OAS and the value is a JSON Object that is merged with the existing JSON Object at that location.

filterModels.description: List of model names to filter out. This is useful if you don't want to generate a model for a specific schema.

optionalParameters.description:
Can be configured to make specified parameters optional in the
  SDKs. This can be useful if you have a set of parameters you would rather
  instantiate on the top-level client to avoid redundant passing of this
  parameter. For example if you have a "version" parameter that you repeatedly
  pass throughout the operations, you can instead make it optional, add it as a
  client state, and implement a request hook to attach the "version" client
  state to the operation.

progressYamlPath.description: Overrides the path of progress.yaml which is used in the "konfig fix" CLI command. This is helpful if you have a staging and production OpenAPI Specification and you want to host two different SDK repos for staging and production releases but want to share the same progress for "konfig fix".

filterPaths.description: Filter operations from OpenAPI spec by path and method. Filtered operations won't be generated in SDKs. Omitting method will filter all methods for the path.

tagPriority.description: Order of tags to be processed by Konfig. This can be used to configure which operation is used when generated the getting started documentation in the generated README for an SDK.

takeFirstTag.description: Multiple tags can cause conflicts for TypeScript SDK

removeDefaultArrayValues.description: Default array value is not supported in Java SDK

convertArrayDataTypesToAny.description: Array data type is not supported in TypeScript SDK for OAS 3.1

mapTags.description: A JSON where the key is a tag name and the value is the new tag name. Allows you to modify tags by name.

mockServerPort.description: To configure the port of the mock server for generated tests. This will ensure that the SDK client is configured to point to the correct port on the local machine (e.g. http://127.0.0.1:{mockServerPort}).

from.description: Relative path from directory that contains konfig.yaml to file that you want to copy

to.description: Relative path from directory that contains konfig.yaml to destination you want to copy to

konfigIgnore.description: Relative path to a .konfigignore file. If specified, we parse the .konfigignore file and copy all files that it matches to the current directory.

copyFiles.description: Configure copying a set of files from a source to a destination. This is useful if you have custom implementations that you would like duplicated across multiple SDK repos.

apiDocumentationAuthenticationPartial.description: Filepath to file containing override for the section in generated documentation for setting up authentication in the SDK.

script.description: Series of commands that are sequentially executed to test the SDK

groupId.description: Uniquely identifies your JVM-based project (ex. "com.acme"). By default we publish packages under Konfig's group id of "com.konfigthis". If you would like to publish to your own group ID then create a Sonatype account (https://central.sonatype.org/publish/publish-guide/#initial-setup) and claim your group ID and add "dphuang2" to the list of users that can publish to your group ID.

removeKonfigBranding.description: Don't add Konfig branding to generated SDK

clientState.description: A list of stateful properties generated into the SDK that can be used in custom implementation hooks. This is useful when you need state in the SDK that is not described in the OpenAPI Specification such as a key used for request signing.

required.description: Configures SDKs to validate that this client state is non-empty. (e.g. not empty string '' or null)

clientStateWithExamples.description: A list of stateful properties generated into the SDK that can be used in custom implementation hooks. This is useful when you need state in the SDK that is not described in the OpenAPI Specification such as a key used for request signing. This is different from the "clientState" field in that it also includes examples for the generated documentation

toStringReturnsJson.description: Modify the behavior of toString() for generated schema classes to return a parsable JSON string as opposed to a string representation of the object's properties. This could be useful when you want to log the contents of a schema class without having to manually serialize it to JSON.

gemName.description: The name of the gem on rubygems.org (e.g. https://rubygems.org/gems/GEM_NAME)

useDescriptionInOperationTableDocumentat.description: Whether or not to use the operation's description in the operation table documentation. By default the summary is used.

readmeHeaderSnippet.description: A snippet of markdown that will be inserted at the top of the README.md file. This is useful for adding a custom header to the README.md file that is not generated by Konfig.

responseTypeVersion.description: Choose which version of Konfig's implementation of responses for the Python SDK to use.

useAiohttp3_8.description: Use aiohttp 3.8.4 instead of the latest version. This is useful if you want to continue publishing your Python SDK with Python 3.7 compatability since the next version of aiohttp requires Python 3.8.

clientStateIsOptional.description: Whether or not to raise an error if client state is provided

defaultAsyncTimeout.description: Configure a default timeout for async operations. By default the timeout will be the default inherited from aiohttp which is 300 seconds (5 minutes).

keepAllParametersOptional.description: This is a feature flag for ensuring that all parameters stay optional in the case of Python SDKs that have been published and distributed to developers already and want to preserve backwards compatability. Particularly we want to handle flattened kwargs and "query_params" / "header_params" form arguments.

useAxios0_27_2.description: Use axios 0.27.2 instead of the latest version. This is useful if you want to continue publishing your TypeScript SDK without making breaking changes since the next version of axios has some interface differences as described here: https://github.com/bmuenzenmeyer/axios-1.0.0-migration-guide.

dependencies.description: A map of dependencies to add to the generated package.json. This is useful for adding dependencies that are required for the SDK to work.

packageJsonScripts.description: A map of scripts to add to the generated package.json. This is useful for adding custom scripts that run tests or build the SDK.

clientName.description: The top-level client's name. (e.g. 'Acme' in "import { Acme } from 'acme-typescript-sdk'")

npmName.description: The name of the npm package (e.g. "acme-typescript-sdk" in "import { Acme } from 'acme-typescript-sdk'")

pagination.description: Enable pagination for operations in which the parameters are a superset of the 'parameters' array and     the response fields are a superset of the 'response' array.

rateLimitRetry.description: Configure retry options for rate limit errors (Error code 429).     Initial delay is measured in ms and is doubled every subsequent attempt where the response is a 429 error.

useSecurityKeyNameAsPropertyName.description:
Consider the following security scheme: { accessToken: { type: apiKey, name: authorization, in: header }}.
The default behavior is to use the (camelCased) header name as the Configuration property name (e.g. "authorization").
If this flag is set to true, then the key name will be used instead (e.g. "accessToken").

removeDefaultConfigurationParameters.description: Removes default fields (username, password, apiKey, and accessToken) from ConfigurationParameters class

logoPath.description: The path to a logo image that is copied to the generated C# SDK to be used as an image on https://nuget.org. This is required and important for branding your SDK.

packageName.description: The name of this package that shows up on https://nuget.org (e.g. "Acme.Net")

packagistUsername.description: The username used to publish to packagist.org

clientName.description: The top-level client's name. (e.g. 'Acme' in "final acme = Acme();")

specInputPath.description: Configure an "input" path for your OpenAPI Specification. This is useful when you want to persist two different versions of your OpenAPI Specification. One that is an exact copy from another location that is either polled from an endpoint or pushed from another Git repository. Another that is modified to be used for code generation. Konfig will detect that this field is set and write or read from it in place of "specPath" for operations like "konfig fix", "konfig pull", and "konfig push".
